me.alb_i986.selenium.tinafw.tasks

Interface WebTask

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    RunnableTask
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseWebTask, CanCompliment, CompositeWebTask, ImLoggedInBase, ManualNavigationWebTask, MyBrowserIsOpen, NavigationWebTask, OnMyAboutMePage, OrWebTask, Search, SingleUserInteraction, VerifyBio, VerifySocialIcons

    public interface WebTask
    A WebTask is supposed to simulate a user interaction with the SUT. E.g.:
    • open the browser
    • navigate to some URL of the SUT
    • login
    • click buttons, links, fill forms, etc.

    WebTask uses page objects to carry on its logic. It is the gate between the layer 'tests' and 'pages', the one that makes for maintainable test suites. In fact, it allows for sharing code among tests. Each concrete WebTask should be as fine-grained as possible: the finer, the more reusable, the better. Fine-grained WebTask's can be then chained together, thanks to CompositeWebTask. Each WebTask in a chain is able to continue the interaction with the SUT from the page the previous task was visiting.

    Concrete WebTask's should be parametrized by fields: they should define a field for each piece of test data they need, along with a fluent setter method. Test data should be stored (statically, i.e. hardcoded, or dynamically, e.g. in a DB) in test classes and passed to WebTask's via the fluent setter methods.

    It is best to think of a WebTask as a Given, When, or Then step. Please, see also BDD.

    See Also:
    CompositeWebTask

      WebUser getUser() 
      default OrWebTask or(WebTask alternativeTask)

    • Method Detail

      • run

        WebPage run(WebPage initialPage)
        Perform this task as the user getUser(). Precondition: the user must have already been set (see setUser(WebUser)).
        Parameters:
        initialPage - the page it is displayed before this task starts
        Returns:
        the last page that is displayed after this task finishes

      • or

        default OrWebTask or(WebTask alternativeTask)
        Builds an OrWebTask made up of (in order) this task and the given alternative task. This method can be "recursively" chained in order to define a multi-member OR, e.g.: 
         
 new MyTask()
    .or(new AlternativeTask1())
    .or(new AlternativeTask2())
    .or(new AlternativeTask3())
 ;
        Parameters:
        alternativeTask - the task to run if this task fails
        Returns:
        an OrWebTask made up of (in order) this task and the alternative

      • setUser

        WebTask setUser(WebUser user)
        Parameters:
        user - the user this task will run as.
        Returns:
        this

      • getUser

        WebUser getUser()
        Returns:
        the user that this task runs as
